page.title: 02Thorpe Marsh Nature Reserve
page.content: The nature reserve,an area of 320 acres,is situated near the six great cooling towers of{Thorpe Marsh}power station.To get a permit for the nature reserve please contact: { Mr G. Mitchell, {79, Jossey Lane, {Scawthorpe, {Nr. Doncaster, {South Yorkshire. The reserve was opened next to the power station,because when the station was completed in 1960 there was a huge sandpit used for the foundations of an unbuilt cooling tower.The pit filled with water and gradually formed a pond.Slowly,but surely,wading birds came to the pond.An artificial lake had to be built and they called it{ {Thorpe Mere}.The reserve was finally opened in 1980,by{"One Man and His {Dog"}star{Phil Drabble}.
